intro: Euphrasia brownii var. striata, commonly known as the striped eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its leaves are opposite and have a distinctive, finely toothed margin. The species is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
